ingredients: 1/4 cup reduced sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth
instructions: In a large kettle, bring 3 qts.
of water to a boil; add corn.
Return to a boil; cook for 3-5 minutes or until tender.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, melt butter.
Stir in the chili powder, pepper, garlic powder and cayenne; cook and stir for 1 minute.
Combine cornstarch and broth until smooth; gradually whisk into butter mixture.
Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until slightly thickened.
Drain corn; serve with seasoned butter.
title: Cajun Buttered Corn

normalized_ingredients.569: reduced sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth

steps: In a large kettle, bring 3 qts. of water to a boil; add corn. Return to a boil; cook for 3-5 minutes or until tender.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, melt butter. Stir in the chili powder, pepper, garlic powder and cayenne; cook and stir for 1 minute. Combine cornstarch and broth until smooth; gradually whisk into butter mixture. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Drain corn; serve with seasoned butter.
